attributes.action: Make it the law to let students go to toilet during lessons
attributes.additional_details: Schools lock toilets during lessons and many people need the toilet during lessons but have undiagnosed bladder problems. This needs to change.
attributes.background: Students are currently not allowed to go to the toilet during lessons and it should be the law due to 2 or 3 people per class have issues going to the toilet says the NHS.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions on policies regarding when students can leave the classroom are a matter for individual schools and teachers, not the UK Government or House of Commons.

If you are unhappy with how a school or teacher deals with requests to use the toilet, you should raise this with the school or relevant local authority.
